description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of some activity to be performed, independent of a particular patient, practitioner, or other performance context.

url.description: An absolute URL that is used to identify this asset when it is referenced. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this asset is (or will be) published.

identifier.description: A logical identifier for the asset such as the CMS or NQF identifiers for a measure. Note that at least one identifier is required for non-experimental active assets.

version.description: The version of the asset, if any. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active assets.

name.description: A machine-friendly name for the asset. This name should be usable as an identifier for the asset by machine processing applications such as code generation.

title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the asset.

experimental.description: Determines whether the asset was developed for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used in production environments.

description.description: A free text natural language description of the asset from the consumer's perspective.

purpose.description: A brief description of the purpose of the asset.

usage.description: A detailed description of how the asset is used from a clinical perspective.

publicationDate.description: The date on which the asset was published.

lastReviewDate.description: The date on which the asset content was last reviewed.

effectivePeriod.description: The period during which the asset content is effective.

coverage.description: Specifies various attributes of the patient population for whom and/or environment of care in which, the knowledge asset is applicable.

topic.description: Clinical topics related to the content of the asset.

contributor.description: A contributor to the content of the asset, including authors, editors, reviewers, and endorsers.

publisher.description: The name of the individual or organization that published the asset (also known as the steward for the asset). This information is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

copyright.description: A copyright statement relating to the asset and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the asset.

relatedResource.description: Related resources such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

library.description: A reference to a Library resource containing any formal logic used by the asset.

category.description: High-level categorization of the type of activity.

code.description: Detailed description of the type of activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

timingCodeableConcept.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

timingTiming.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

location.description: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

participantType.description: The type of participant in the action.

productReference.description: Identifies the food, drug or other product being consumed or supplied in the activity.

productCodeableConcept.description: Identifies the food, drug or other product being consumed or supplied in the activity.

quantity.description: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed at once (per dose, per meal, etc.).

transform.description: A reference to a StructureMap resource that defines a transform that can be executed to produce the intent resource using the ActivityDefinition instance as the input.

dynamicValue.description: Dynamic values that will be evaluated to produce values for elements of the resulting resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a dynamic value would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the intent resource that would contain the result.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of some activity to be performed, independent of a particular patient, practitioner, or other performance context.

description.description: A brief, natural language description of the intended semantics of the dynamic value.

path.description: The path to the element to be customized. This is the path on the resource that will hold the result of the calculation defined by the expression.

language.description: The media type of the language for the expression.

expression.description: An expression specifying the value of the customized element.
